macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Major Indices Rise on Tech Strength Led by TSMC
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.3% to 6,944.5, Nasdaq gained 0.3% to 23,530, and Dow climbed 0.6% to 49,442, driven by Taiwan Semiconductor's upbeat 2026 outlook and increased capital spending, boosting chip stocks like Applied Materials up 5.7%. European equities edged higher while Asian markets slipped due to China policy impacts on Hong Kong tech.

items.title: Bank Earnings Mixed as Q4 Season Kicks Off
items.summary: J.P. Morgan Chase missed earnings estimates and reported lower profits, with shares falling; Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and Bank of America beat adjusted earnings but had mixed revenue results, amid concerns over potential credit card rate caps. S&P 500 companies are expected to grow earnings 15% in 2026, with focus shifting to Netflix, Intel, and Magnificent 7.

items.title: Fed Rate Cut Odds Drop Sharply Ahead of January Meeting
items.summary: CME Fed Watch Tool shows 97.2% probability of no change in fed funds rate at January meeting, down from 24.4% cut odds a month ago, influenced by upcoming inflation data. Markets await Fed's policy decision amid resilient economic signals.

items.title: Mixed US Economic Data Signals Cooling Labor Market
items.summary: JOLTS data showed a sharp drop in job openings indicating cooling labor demand, ADP reported modest private hiring rebound, and ISM Services PMI beat expectations, supporting a view of slowing but resilient economy. US Treasury yields rose, with 10-year at 4.170% and 2-year at 3.565%, lifting dollar index 0.23% to 99.36.

items.title: VIX Eases as Market Volatility Remains Low
items.summary: VIX fell 5.43% to 15.84, with short-dated volatility low and options implying modest S&P 500 move of ±0.5% or ±32 points, showing limited near-term protection demand despite headline sensitivity.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: US Senators Unveil Draft Crypto Regulatory Framework Bill
items.summary: U.S. senators introduced long-awaited legislation to create a regulatory framework for cryptocurrency, clarifying jurisdiction for financial regulators and addressing stablecoin issues. The bill is set for Senate Banking Committee debate on Thursday, potentially boosting digital asset adoption.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Hits $3.27T with 0.83% Daily Gain
items.summary: The total cryptocurrency market capitalization reached $3.27 trillion, up 0.83% in the last 24 hours, while Bitcoin nears $100K amid strong ETF inflows of $18 billion. Major outperformers include GLMR (+23%), DASH (+18%), and MET (+16%).

items.title: CME Group to Launch Cardano, Chainlink, and Stellar Futures
items.summary: CME Group announced plans to launch futures contracts for Cardano, Chainlink, and Stellar, expanding regulated crypto derivatives offerings. This move aims to provide more institutional access to these altcoins.

items.title: Belgium's KBC Group Launches Bitcoin and Ethereum Trading
items.summary: KBC Group, a major Belgian bank, will launch trading services for Bitcoin and Ethereum, marking a significant step in mainstream crypto adoption in Europe. This follows partnerships like Bank of Bahrain and Kuwait's Binance integration.

items.title: X Bans InfoFi Post-to-Earn Apps, KAITO Token Drops 20%
items.summary: X (formerly Twitter) banned InfoFi 'post-to-earn' apps, causing a sector-wide selloff with Kaito sunsetting Yaps and pivoting to Kaito Studio; KAITO token fell 20%. This regulatory clampdown impacts emerging crypto incentive models.

items.title: Bitcoin ETFs See $18B Inflows as Price Holds Above $95K
items.summary: Bitcoin ETFs recorded $18 billion in inflows over consecutive days, supporting BTC's price stability above $95K and a market cap share of 59%. Derivatives show $110B open interest amid $82M liquidations.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: OpenAI Invests in Brain-Computer Interface Company Merge Labs
items.summary: OpenAI has participated in seed funding for Merge Labs, a brain-computer interface company co-founded by CEO Sam Altman, aiming to create non-invasive BCIs that enable seamless human-AI interaction without hardware implants.

items.title: Machine Learning Accelerates Discovery of Novel Cancer Drug Candidates
items.summary: Researchers used AI-powered virtual screening to identify 14 potential CDK9 inhibitor molecules for cancer treatment, ultimately selecting one compound showing promising cytotoxic effects in multiple cancer cell lines.

items.title: Congress Reverses Trump's Proposed Science Budget Cuts
items.summary: U.S. senators and representatives are rescinding proposed funding reductions to science and even boosting funds for basic research after White House called for billions in cuts.

items.title: Anthropic and OpenAI Advance AI Applications in Healthcare
items.summary: Both companies announced new initiatives focused on healthcare and life sciences research, with Anthropic advancing Claude for healthcare applications and OpenAI introducing ChatGPT Health.

items.title: Quandela Identifies Four Key Quantum Computing Trends for 2026
items.summary: Quantum computing is transitioning from research to early adoption, with key trends including hybrid quantum-classical computing, industrial use cases, error correction advances, and cybersecurity implications.

items.title: Kaggle Launches Community Benchmarks for AI Model Evaluation
items.summary: Google-owned Kaggle introduced Community Benchmarks, enabling AI practitioners to create and share custom evaluations for models, democratizing the assessment process for real-world applications.

items.title: MindHYVE.ai Partners with Open University of Kenya on AI-Powered Learning
items.summary: MindHYVE.ai and the Open University of Kenya signed a Memorandum of Understanding to collaborate on AI-powered learning enablement and academic innovation initiatives.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: TSMC Reports Strong Profits and 25% Capex Increase, Boosting Chip Stocks
items.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. announced robust earnings and plans for a 25% rise in capital expenditures this year, reigniting investor enthusiasm in semiconductors. The news lifted TSMC shares 2.7% and supported gains in related stocks like Applied Materials and KLA.

items.title: US and Taiwan Secure Trade Deal Reducing Tariffs and Boosting Chip Investments
items.summary: The US and Taiwan clinched a trade pact that cuts tariffs and expands chip investment agreements originally struck in 2021. This supports semiconductor expansion amid strong demand from tech giants.

items.title: NTT Releases IOWN Technology Report on Optical-Quantum Trajectory
items.summary: NTT published the 'NTT IOWN Technology Report — Quantum Leap: Charting the Optical-Quantum Trajectory,' detailing advancements in photonics-electronics convergence, all-photonics networks, and applications for data centers and space industry.

items.title: Glass Cloth Shortage Emerges as Critical Bottleneck for Semiconductor Manufacturing
items.summary: Japanese manufacturer Nittobo faces surging demand for glass cloth used in advanced PCBs, courted by Apple, Nvidia, Google, and Amazon, potentially constraining next-gen device production and raising costs.

items.title: Defense Unicorns Raises $136M Series B, Achieving Unicorn Valuation
items.summary: Colorado-based Defense Unicorns secured $136 million in Series B funding led by Bain Capital, pushing its valuation over $1 billion for secure software delivery tools in U.S. military systems.
